description.narrative: Output 2: People centred services enhanced due to more effective and professional civil service.

activity-description.narrative: People centred services enhanced due to more effective and professional civil service

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 2.1 # of government agencies that use a competency-based framework to recruit staff 2.2 # of government agencies that use performance-based management to evaluate and promote civil servants 2.3 Proportion of the population satisfied with their last experience of public services (SDG Indicator 16.6.2) 2.4 % of wo/men SELDS participants stating that the leadership system improved their capacity to be more effective leaders in their respective government agency 2.5 % of CICS courses that are competency-based 2.6 % of wo/men civil servants stating that competency-based courses enable them to tackle better real-life management issues at work

comment.narrative:
2.1 # of government agencies that use a competency-based framework to recruit staff (2017): Level 1: 0 Level 2: 0 Level 3: 0
2.2 # of government agencies that use performance-based management to evaluate and promote civil servants: 0 (2017)
2.3 Proportion of the population satisfied with their last experience of public services (SDG Indicator 16.6.2): village level-61% Township Level-48%, States/Regions-45%, Union level-NA (2014)
2.4 % of wo/men SELDS participants stating that the leadership system improved their capacity to be more effective leaders in their respective government agency: 0%W 0%M (2017)
2.5 % of CICS courses that are competency-based: 0% (2018)
2.6 % of wo/men civil servants stating that competency-based courses enable them to tackle better real-life management issues at work: 0% (2019)

*Targets on indicators from M&E framework 2019*
2.1 # of government agencies that use a competency-based framework to recruit staff: Level 1: 3 Level 2: 3 Level 3: 1
2.2 # of government agencies that use performance-based management to evaluate and promote civil servants: 1
2.3 % of wo/men (and proportion of with disabilities) satisfied with their last experience of public services (SDG Indicator 16.6.2): 86%W 84%M
2.4 % of wo/men SELDS participants stating that the leadership system improved their capacity to be more effective leaders in their respective government agency: 0%W 0%M
2.5 % of CICS courses that are competency-based: 10%
2.6 % of wo/men (and proportion of with disability) civil servants stating that competency-based courses enable them to tackle better real-life management issues at work: 0%W 0%M

*Results on indicators from M&E framework 2019*
Result on indicator 2.1 # of government agencies that use a competency-based framework to recruit staff Level 1: 1 Level 2: 0 Level 3: 0 Competency Framework and toolkit adopted by UCSB; job descriptions for three upper ranks adopted
Result on indicator 2.2 # of government agencies that use performance-based management to evaluate and promote civil servants: 1 New performance management practices and evaluation form introduced at UCSB and presented to all ministries and state/regions.
Result on indicator 2.3 % of wo/men (and proportion of with disabilities) satisfied with their last experience of public services (SDG Indicator 16.6.2): 86%W 84%M (PPSoGS report and computational method under approval)
Result on indicator 2.4 % of wo/men SELDS participants stating that the leadership system improved their capacity to be more effective leaders in their respective government agency: 0%W 0%M as anticipated Senior and Executive course assessment, re-design and ToT of 42 CICS professors conducted. Pilot of competency-based executive management course conducted in Q1 of 2020
Result on indicator 2.5 % of CICS courses that are competency-based: 0%LM )%UM Senior and Executive course assessment, re-design and ToT of 42 CICS professors conducted. Pilot of competency-based executive management course conducted in Q1 of 2020
Result on indicator 2.6 % of wo/men (and proportion of with disability) civil servants stating that competency-based courses enable them to tackle better real-life management issues at work: 0% as anticipated Comprehensive re-design of CICS under development.

2.1 # of government agencies that use a competency-based framework to recruit staff: Target : Level 1- 10 / Level 2- 10/ Level 3- 8
2.2 # of government agencies that use performance-based management to evaluate and promote civil servants: Target: 4
2.3 % of wo/men (and proportion of with disabilities) satisfied with their last experience of public services (SDG Indicator 16.6.2): Target: N/A
2.4 % of wo/men SELDS participants stating that the leadership system improved their capacity to be more effective leaders in their respective government agency. Target: 80%W; 80%M
2.5 % of CICS courses that are competency-based Target: 60% (UM); 60% (LM)
2.6 % of wo/men (and proportion of with disability) civil servants stating that competency-based courses enable them to tackle better real-life management issues at work. Target: 80%W; 80%M; PWD: 1/2

Results on Indicators from M&E Framework (Jan-Dec 2020)
Result on Indicator 2.1: # of government agencies that use a competency-based framework to recruit civil servants: Status: On track This is annual target and has been achieved partially. Competency framework for UCSB has been developed and being approved from UGO. This will be further applied by the ministries/ departments in next year.
Result on Indicator 2.2: # of government agencies that use performance-based management to evaluate and promote civil servants: Status: On track New Performance management system designed and approved by UGO. Furthermore, 3 ministries are piloting this framework i.e., MoE, MoHS, and Ministry of Labour, Population & Immigration
Result on Indicator 2.3: Proportion of the population satisfied with their last experience of public services (SDG Indicator 16.6.2): Status: On track Not applicable for this year. PPSOGS already conducted in 2019 and next will be done in 2022, end of the project. The 2019 data shows; Urban: 80%; Rural: 87% Male: 84%; Female: 86% State: 83% ; Region: 86% Age group up to 34: 83%; Age group 35 and above: 86%
Result on Indicator 2.4: % of wo/men SELDS participants stating that the leadership system improved their capacity to be more effective leaders in their respective government agency: Status: On track First session of SELD was conducted in January and a SELD- ToT is conducted online due to COVID-19. SELDs Participants stated that UNDP pilot increase our capacity to tackle better these management issues at work; responses were; 71.43% respondent stated “A lot” 21.43% stated “A moderate amount “ 7.14% stated “not so much” 0.00% “not at all”
Result on Indicator 2.5: % of CICS courses that are competency-based: Status: On track CICS Senior and Executive Management courses has been revised and are completely competency based. Curriculum approved by the UGO.
Result on Indicator 2.6: % of wo/men civil servants stating that competency-based courses enable them to tackle better real-life management issues at work: Status: On track
SELD new course will be conducted next year. This year only ToT is conducted online for Professors of 2 CICS. Once the course is done, the data will be collected through evaluation form.

2.1 # of government agencies that use a competency-based framework to recruit staff: Target : Level 1- 15 Level 2- 15 Level 3- 10
2.2 # of government agencies that use performance-based management to evaluate and promote civil servants: Target: 8
2.3 % of wo/men (and proportion of with disabilities) satisfied with their last experience of public services (SDG Indicator 16.6.2): Target: 86%W 84%M
2.4 % of wo/men SELDS participants stating that the leadership system improved their capacity to be more effective leaders in their respective government agency. Target: 85%W 85%M (competent managers for the civil service)
2.5 % of CICS courses that are competency-based Target: 70% (UM); 70% (LM)
2.6 % of wo/men (and proportion of with disability) civil servants stating that competency-based courses enable them to tackle better real-life management issues at work. Target: 84%W 87%M PWD: 1/2

Results on Indicators from M&E Framework (Jan-Dec 2021)
Result on Indicator 2.1: # of government agencies that use a competency-based framework to recruit civil servants: Status: Competency-based Job Descriptions for Senior Officials of the Civil Service approved by Union Government Office in 2020 and this will be further applied by the ministries/ departments.
Result on Indicator 2.2: # of government agencies that use performance-based management to evaluate and promote civil servants: Status: New Performance management system designed and approved by Union Government Office. Furthermore, 3 ministries (Ministry of Education, Ministry of Health and Sports, and Ministry of Labour, Population & Immigration) piloted this framework. Report on Piloting of PMS was requested and UCSB didn’t provide it.
Result on Indicator 2.3: % of wo/men (and proportion of with disabilities) satisfied with their last experience of public services (SDG Indicator 16.6.2): Status: Not applicable for this year. Public Perception Survey of Government Services (PPSoGS) conducted in 2019 and the next one was planned to do in 2022. But it cannot be anymore, and the project is being shift to the Community First Programme. The 2019 data shows; Urban: 80%; Rural: 87% Male: 84%; Female: 86% State: 83% ; Region: 86% Age group up to 34: 83%; Age group 35 and above: 86%
Result on Indicator 2.4: % of wo/men SELDS participants stating that the leadership system improved their capacity to be more effective leaders in their respective government agency. Status: No data received in 2021.
Result on Indicator 2.5: % of CICS courses that are competency-based Status: No data received in 2021.
Result on Indicator 2.6: % of wo/men (and proportion of with disability) civil servants stating that competency-based courses enable them to tackle better real-life management issues at work. Status: No data received in 2021.
